Articles.Content:
So I was watching a documentary about what would happen if Earth never had a moon and while they were describing the environment if the mars-sized planet never hit, it sounded VERY similar to Laythe. Continue watching and it will sound VERY familiar.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S53nLob2SoM&feature=relmfu

(Skip to 4:06)

So perhaps, if Laythe had a moon, it would end up like a clone of Kerbin..
That sounds a lot like Patrick Stewart.
I wish my voice was as soothing as Patrick Stewart's.
Pretty interesting video though. And it does seem at least somewhat similar to Laythe. Though if we had to strictly transfer our physics to the Kerbal universe, Laythe should be a ball of frozen ice.

Pretty interesting video though. And it does seem at least somewhat similar to Laythe. Though if we had to strictly transfer our physics to the Kerbal universe, Laythe should be a ball of frozen ice.
Maybe the liquid on laythe isn't water, maybe liquid methane like titan?

Maybe the liquid on laythe isn't water, maybe liquid methane like titan?

With an oxygen atmosphere? While that sounds very Kerbal, I don't think the planet would survive its first meteor strike, let alone a rocket, jet, or campfire. Actually, I wouldn't be surprised if a sneeze set the planet off.

So I guess what I'm saying is: I hope you're right!
